summary: Guanyin, short for Guanshiyin, is a compassionate bodhisattva in Buddhism, often associated with Avalokite≈õvara. They are believed to hear the world's sounds and help those in need. Guanyin is celebrated on the 19th day of the sixth lunar month and is revered across East Asia in temples like Shaolin Monastery and Longxing Temple. Their abode is Mount Potalaka, with each region adopting its own version. Guanyin is beloved by many Buddhist traditions and is also found in Taoist and folk religion practices. They are often depicted in art and are a popular subject in museums worldwide.
title: Guanyin
